div.l: There lyth vp on̄ my wombe / and on̄ my hede
Help Symkyn̄ for þe fals Clerkes fight
This Iohn stert vp / as fast as eủere he myght
And grapeth by þe walles / to and froo
To fynd a staf and she stirt vp also
And knewe the estrees bet þan did this Iohn
And by the wall a staf she fonde anon̄
And sawe a litle skemeryng of a light
For at an hole / in shone the mone bright
And by þᵗat light she sawe hem both two
But sekerly she nyst / who was who
But as she saugh / a white thyng in her ee
And whan̄ she gan̄ this white thing espee
She wende the Clerk hade wered a volupere
And wᵗith the staf she drough ay nere and nere
And wend han̄ hit this Aleyn̄ at the full
And smote the Miller on̄ the pilled skull
That doun̄ he goth and kried harrow I dye
The Clerkes bet hym wele / and let hym lye
And ordeyned hem / and toke her hors anon̄
And eke her mele / and on̄ her waye þey gon̄
And at the mylle / yitte they toke her cake
Of half a busshell flour͗e / full wele ybake
Thus is þe proude myller wele ybete
And hath lost the gryndyng of þe whete
And payde for the soꝑpere eủerydele
Of Aleyn̄ and Iohn þat bet hym wele
His wyf is swyfed and his doughter als
Lo soch it is a Myller to be fals
And þ̉erfore this ꝓproverbe is seid full soth
Hym dare nat wene wele / þᵗat yvell doth
A gylour͗e shall hym self begyled be
And god þat sitteth hie in mageste
Save all this company grete and smale
Thus haue I quytte the myller in my tale
Thus endeth the Reves tale

and begynneth
the ꝓprologge of the Cook of London̄
